Key Arguments: The bill is equated to censorship, which has historically been used by regimes to maintain power and suppress opposition.
The last three years of censorship have led to negative outcomes, including disability and death.
The bill is seen as dangerous, undemocratic, and contrary to the values of the country.
The bill gives the government excessive power, which could lead to corruption.
The bill undermines trust in the government.
Main Themes: Empowerment of individuals to make their own decisions
Notable Quotes: I oppose this bill with every fibre of my being.
This bill tells me my government wants to propagandise me, and my fellow Australians.
If this bill goes through it will signal to me, as an Australian Citizen, is that I should NEVER EVER trust a single word that comes out of the governmentâ€™s mouth.
How about instead of trying to control us, and telling us what we should think, you actually treat us like the adults we are.
